intro: Hieracium aspretorum, commonly known as the asperous hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and rocky areas, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are usually hairy and have a rough texture, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Hieracium aspretorum is often found in open habitats and can thrive in both sunny and partially shaded conditions.
